Race.SpecificTitle: PW School District -- Local Option - Term Limits
Race.FullText:
"LOCAL OPTION ELECTION
Within St. Bernard Parish School District:
Shall the number of terms of office that any member of the school board may serve be limited to three consecutive four-year terms?"

Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Charter Amendment)

Summary:  Amendment to Article VIII, to amend Section 8-04 (Ethics Board) for selection of board members for St. Bernard Parish.
Race.FullText:
Shall Article VIII, Section 8-04 of the Home Rule Charter of the Parish of St. Bernard, State of Louisiana, be amended to read as follows:
(a) The St. Bernard Parish Ethics Board (hereinafter referred to as the ethics board) shall be composed of (5) five members. 
(b) The members shall be selected from nominations submitted by the presidents/chancellors from the following institutions of higher learning:  1. University of New Orleans 2. Loyola University 3. Tulane University 4. Xavier University 5. Nunez Community College
The members of the Board of Ethics shall serve a term of four years?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Communications Dist. -- 911 Service Charge - BOC
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Communications District)
(In-Lieu)

Summary:  Authority for the St. Bernard Parish Communications District to amend its existing emergency telephone service charges to levy such charges on a uniform flat fee schedule of fixed rates not based on any tariff rate, for the purpose of improving, maintaining and operating an enhanced 911 emergency telephone system and for any other authorized purposes of the District, to be levied in perpetuity.
Race.FullText: Shall the St. Bernard Parish Communications District, State of Louisiana (the "District") be authorized to amend its existing emergency telephone service charges to levy such charges on a uniform flat fee schedule of fixed rates not based on any tariff rate, at a rate not to exceed one dollar per month ($1.00) for each residential line, two dollars and seven cents per month ($2.07) for each commercial line and one dollar and twenty-six cents ($1.26) per month for each cellular or other wireless telecommunications service, to be levied in perpetuity, for the purpose of improving, maintaining and operating an enhanced 911 emergency telephone system and for any other authorized purposes of the District, all in accordance with Act No. 341 of the 2012 Regular Session of the Louisiana Legislature, such service charges estimated to generate approximately $546,000 per year, an increase of approximately $186,000 per year?
